worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #5627: ARROW-6860: [Python][C++] Do not link shared libraries monolithically to pyarrow.lib, move Python Flight bindings to libarrow_flight.so
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5627
 
 
   This inverts the dependency so that when ARROW_PYTHON=ON that libarrow_flight.so will link to libarrow_python.so rather than the other way around. This allows us to link *only* `pyarrow._flight` to `libarrow_flight.so`
   
   Because Apache ORC also needs to statically link Protocol Buffers, I have disabled it in the manylinux wheels. Hopefully we can come up with a solution where projects like Apache Beam, TensorFlow, and others can all use Protocol Buffers together and not have these problems
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: See BEAM-8368. We need to find a strategy to mitigate protobuf static linking issues with teh Beam community

comments.body: It's a general issue with our Cython extensions. We link them each with all Arrow DLLs (including gandiva AFAIR)....
Yes, we'll have to make changes to python/CMakeLists.txt to link less monolithically. I can take a look at it
That won't help as libarrow_python will still link against Flight. You'll need a libarrow_python_flight as well.
Ah good point. That is tricky.
